meanings.definition: Done or carried out in a botched manner.
meanings.sent1: The botchedly attempt at fixing the leak only made it worse.
meanings.sent2: The botchedly repair job left the door crooked.
meanings.sent3: The botchedly painted wall looked like a messy rainbow.
meanings.sent4: Her botchedly wrapped gift resembled a crumpled paper ball.
meanings.sent5: The botchedly haircut made her look like she had lost a bet.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is bungled or poorly executed.
meanings.sent1: He botchedly tried to juggle the balls but dropped them all.
meanings.sent2: She botchedly attempted to fix the broken vase with glue.
meanings.sent3: The magician botchedly pulled a rabbit out of his hat, but it was a rubber toy.
meanings.sent4: The singer botchedly forgot the lyrics during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The chef botchedly added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
